p:
Angiotensin II, the main effector molecule in the RAAS, is upregulated in many diseases and is a common treatment target for various cardiovascular disorders
61, 100, 113 . ACE2 inactivates angiotensin II by converting angiotensin II to angiotensin (1–7)
61, 100 . Cryogenic electron microscopy studies have demonstrated that the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 can directly bind to human ACE2 with a similar or even higher affinity than the binding of the S protein of SARS-CoV to human ACE2 (refs
9– 11 ). In this context, a study has shown that exogenous administration of recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) can prevent SARS-CoV-2 infection by acting as a decoy
114 . The investigators demonstrated that clinical-grade rhACE2 can reduce SARS-CoV-2 infection in cell culture and in engineered human blood vessel organoids and kidney organoids
114 . Given that rhACE2 has been shown to be protective against various CVDs
61, 115, 116 , rhACE2 therapy might be a promising approach to treat patients with COVID-19-related cardiovascular disorders
114 .
